head.title: Lure the Best to a Life of Teaching

hedline.hl1: Lure the Best to a Life of Teaching

abstract.p: Arthur E Levine letter lauding Harold O Levy's Sept 9 article backs steps to lure best and brightest to teaching

block.p: I applaud Harold O. Levy's Sept. 9 Op-Ed article, ''Why the Best Don't Teach.'' For years, educators have talked about why many of our best and brightest are unwilling to consider careers in teaching.

I applaud Harold O. Levy's Sept. 9 Op-Ed article, ''Why the Best Don't Teach.'' For years, educators have talked about why many of our best and brightest are unwilling to consider careers in teaching.

The National Center on Teaching and America's Future at Teachers College issued a report on this topic this year and is currently working in a number of states to produce change. Educators and policy makers know and agree on the reasons.

It's time to stop wringing our hands and to do something to eliminate the obstacles in our state. I am prepared to support or, if he wishes, to join Mr. Levy in taking the first step of convening the parties that have the capacity to change these conditions.
ARTHUR E. LEVINE President, Teachers College Columbia University New York, Sept. 11, 2000
